description: From Middle French voluptueux, from Latin voluptuōsus (“delightful”), from voluptās (“pleasure, delight”), from volup (“with pleasure”).

adjectives.description: voluptuous (comparative more voluptuous, superlative most voluptuous)

entries.meaning: Suggestive of or characterized by full, generous, pleasurable sensation.
examples: The plentiful blankets and the voluptuous pillows of the bed called out to my tired body.

entries.meaning: (of a woman) Curvaceous and sexually attractive.
examples: The low neckline of her bodice emphasised her plump, voluptuous figure.
